labels.analysis: The NASA MCP Server provides a centralized interface to access and interact with a variety of NASA APIs, offering data ranging from space imagery to near-Earth objects, fire information, and space weather. It standardizes data formats for AI model consumption and includes tools for parameter validation and documentation. The core functionality revolves around data retrieval, API integration, and spacecraft-related information access.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality is API integration, as the server provides access to multiple NASA APIs and formats data for AI consumption. Secondary functions include data analysis (processing NASA's scientific data) and space exploration (accessing NASA's space mission data). A custom label is needed to specifically denote NASA's specialized data offerings.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: NASA MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @ProgramComputer/nasa-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Access NASA's vast array of data sources through a standardized interface for AI models. Retrieve and interact with over 20 NASA APIs seamlessly, ensuring optimized data formats for AI consumption. Experience automatic parameter validation and comprehensive documentation to enhance your development process.

tools.description: Deploy Server NASA MCP Server @ProgramComputer/nasa-mcp-server Try in Playground

tools.name: nasa/power

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@ProgramComputer/nasa-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: nasaApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Your NASA API key from https://api.nasa.gov/
